channel.title: Getting No-IP
channel.description:
I am so confused on getting my server to work on a no-ip domain. Please help?
I got my server running, its currently going off from my IP found at whatsmyip.org
I want to get it working on like DEMO.no-ip.org
I did not need to port foward or anything.

item.title: Getting No-IP
item.dc:creator: @xchr0nicx xchr0nicx
item.description:
@xchr0nicx wrote:

Scape-JAVA:

If one has this “http://127.0.0.1” change that to your ip.

Here is the line that had 127.0.0.1, I replaced it to the no-ip and compiled… still not working when I launch DUC.

*/ if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("delta") && !connectedFrom.equals("chr0nicw0rld.no-ip.org") && !connectedFrom.startsWith("adsl-99")){ println("Not from localhost!"); returnCode = 9; disconnected = true; savefile = false; return; }

Read full topic

item.title: Getting No-IP
item.dc:creator: @xchr0nicx xchr0nicx
item.description:
@xchr0nicx wrote:

Ok, well it looks like we almost have this figured out…

Just still need to know what to change to make it work with my new no-ip server URL.

I searched for localhost, and those 2 other IP’s and they came up a few times. What do I need to change, and where exactly?

Read full topic

item.title: Getting No-IP
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“xchr0nicx, post:20, topic:354625”]Ok thanks, here is my public class client line… nothing with localhost or and IP…

public class client extends Player implements Runnable { public boolean DCDamg = false; public int DCdown = 0; public int pkPoints = 0; public int[] lowTask = { 87, 100, 19, 1267, 181, 90, 112, 117, 78, 1153 }; public int[] mediumTask = { 87, 100, 19, 1267, 117, 78, 941, 1338, 912, 913, 914, 2591, 2604, 2610, 1153, 1154 }; public int[] highTask = { 1627, 181, 90, 112, 117, 78, 1183, 941, 2881, 2882, 2883, 2591, 2604, 2610, 1153, 1154 }; public int taskID = -1; public int taskAmount = -1; public boolean PVPToggle = false;

I searched for "localhost"and a bunch of things came up…[/quote]

I was refering to your client when I mentioned Client class.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting No-IP
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

xchr0nicx:

Scape-JAVA I believe you, other dude is confusing me. Thanks, last quick thing, how do I open the .class file?

You don’t. Client.class is the bytecode. You don’t need to edit this.

The correct term is the Client class, this is a reference to Client.java. It’s called the Client class because the first line after the imports is.

public class Client ...

Read full topic

item.title: Getting No-IP
item.dc:creator: @i_bucky_i i bucky i
item.description:
@i_bucky_i wrote:

you dont log into the no-ip on your server you let DUC do tht
and he means open CLIENT.java found in your client folder
and CTRL+F and search 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 or localhost

Read full topic

item.title: Getting No-IP
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“i bucky i, post:15, topic:354625”]no hes wrong
type in your ip in adress bar
go onto port forawring
two titles rsps2
go on run-cmd type ipconfig and enter
find out ur private ip number set it in port forwarding,
go onto yourclient,
have duc open and online
open u torrent
go on rune locas status checker - and you should be online - need help ask[/quote]

You sir, are an idiot. What I was saying is, go to your client, go to your client class open it up find localhost remove it place your no-ip there exit and complie.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting No-IP
item.dc:creator: @xchr0nicx xchr0nicx
item.description:
@xchr0nicx wrote:

Ok look I found this video that helped a tad, my server domain is all chosen and stuff, I downloaded no-ip and opened the DUC thing, logged in and all, and it says all is working…

But when I go onto it with MoparScape it does not work, maybe bad port? I cannot find what port it should be.

chr0nicw0rld.no-ip.org should work…

Read full topic

item.title: Getting No-IP
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“xchr0nicx, post:3, topic:354625”][quote author=Scape-JAVA link=topic=451195.msg3307183#msg3307183 date=1281741404]
www.no-ip.com, there you go.
[/quote]

Thanks, but I know that… I mean like once I register a server URL, how do I get my server to run using that, instead of my IP?[/quote]
Seriously? a No-Ip is a sort of barrier for your real IP, insteal of giving people your IP, you give them the no-ip and they use that to connect instead.

Read full topic
